verses.kjv: When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, and the troop of robbers spoileth without.
verses.ct: Whenever I try to heal Israel, the sin of Ephraim gets exposed, along with the evil of Samaria. They practice deception — thieves break in, and gangs of robbers raid in the streets.

verses.kjv: And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.
verses.ct: They never stop to think that I keep track of all their evil. Their own actions have surrounded them; everything they do is right in my presence.

verses.kjv: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.
verses.ct: They delight the king with their evil and entertain the officials with their lies.

verses.kjv: They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, who ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.
verses.ct: They are all unfaithful — like an oven heated by a baker who stops stoking the fire after kneading the dough, waiting for it to rise.

verses.kjv: In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.
verses.ct: On the day of our king's celebration, the officials made him sick with wine. He joined hands with those who mock.

verses.kjv: For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.
verses.ct: Their hearts smolder like an oven while they plot their schemes. Their passion smolders through the night, then blazes into a roaring fire by morning.

verses.kjv: They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.
verses.ct: They all burn hot like an oven and consume their own leaders. All their kings have fallen, and not one of them calls out to me.

verses.kjv: Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.
verses.ct: Ephraim has blended in with the surrounding nations. Ephraim is like a flatbread flipped on only one side — half-baked.

verses.kjv: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.
verses.ct: Foreigners have drained his strength, but he doesn't realize it. Gray hairs are showing up on him, but he doesn't even notice.

verses.kjv: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the LORD their God, nor seek him for all this.
verses.ct: Israel's arrogance testifies against him, yet they still refuse to come back to the LORD their God or search for him despite all of this.

verses.kjv: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
verses.ct: Ephraim is like a foolish, senseless dove — they cry out to Egypt for help, then run to Assyria.

verses.kjv: When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.
verses.ct: Wherever they go, I will throw my net over them. I will pull them down like birds from the heavens. I will discipline them, just as their assembly has been warned.

verses.kjv: Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.
verses.ct: Disaster will come to them because they have run away from me! Destruction is coming because they have rebelled against me! I wanted to rescue them, but they kept telling lies about me.

verses.kjv: And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, and they rebel against me.
verses.ct: They don't cry out to me sincerely — they just wail on their beds. They gather together for grain and wine, but they turn against me.

verses.kjv: Though I have bound and strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me.
verses.ct: Even though I trained them and made their arms strong, they still plot evil against me.

verses.kjv: They return, but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: They turn, but not to the Most High. They are like a faulty bow that misses its target. Their officials will die by the sword because of their defiant words. This will make them an object of ridicule in the land of Egypt.
